# Trailer Profile

**Trailer:** 2016 Magic Tilt Tandem Axle\
**Vessel:** 2013 Bryant 233 X

## Specifications

-   **Make:** Magic Tilt
-   **Year:** 2016
-   **Type:** Tandem Axle Aluminum I-Beam (Assumed based on typical Magic Tilt construction for this class, verify visual)
-   **Tire Size:** ST205/75R14
-   **Lug Pattern:** 5-Lug
-   **Hitch Size:** 2" Ball
-   **Electrical:** 5-Pin Flat

## Towing Requirements

-   **Vehicle:** Ford F-150
-   **Adapter:** **7-way Round to 5-pin Flat adapter** is REQUIRED.
    -   *Reason:* The 5th pin activates the reverse lockout solenoid on the trailer tongue. Without this, the trailer brakes will lock up when backing up (especially uphill).
-   **Tongue:** Folding tongue (must be secured for towing).
-   **Tie-Downs:** Two (2) Transom Ratchet Straps (Frame to Stern Eyes).

## Operational Tips

-   **Backing Up:** If brakes lock up, check the electrical connection. If the truck plug is dead, use the manual "lockout key" (if available) or insert a pin/coin into the side of the tongue actuator to physically block compression.
-   **Launch Depth:** Do not submerge trailer past the fender tops. Adjust for ramp steepness.
-   **Storage:** Chock wheels. Leave brake actuator uncompressed.
